'''Nancy Margaret Reid''' {{Post-nominals|country=CAN|OC}} (born September 17, 1952<ref name="isi">{{cite web|url=http://www.agnesscott.edu/lriddle/women/reid.htm|title=Nancy Margaret Reid|work=Biographies of Women Mathematicians|accessdate=2011-01-28|author=Larry Riddle|publisher=[[Agnes Scott College]]}}</ref>) is a [[Canadian]] theoretical [[statistician]].

She was an [[associate professor]] at the [[University of British Columbia]] from 1980–5, then joined the [[University of Toronto]] and has remained there ever since, becoming a [[full professor]] in 1988.<ref name="isi"/>

Reid won the [[COPSS Presidents' Award]] in 1992, the [[Krieger–Nelson Prize]] in 1995,<ref>[http://hcr3.isiknowledge.com/author.cgi?id=4694 Reid, Nancy] at [[ISIHighlyCited.com]]. Accessed 2011-01-28.</ref> the [[Statistical Society of Canada]] Gold Medal in 2009,<ref>"Award Winners," 
Statistical Society of Canada, accessed June 9, 2013, 
[http://www.ssc.ca/en/award-winners  http://www.ssc.ca/en/award-winners].</ref> and the [[Statistical Society of Canada]] Distinguished Service Award in 2013,<ref>"2013 SSC Award Winners," 
Statistical Society of Canada, accessed June 9, 2013, 
[www.ssc.ca/en/award-winners/award-winners-2013#service 
www.ssc.ca/en/award-winners/award-winners-2013#service].</ref> She was elected a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Canada]] in 2001.<ref>"Search Fellows," 
Royal Society of Canada, accessed June 9, 2013, 
[http://rsc-src.ca/en/search-fellows http://rsc-src.ca/en/search-fellows].</ref>  She was president of the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]] in 1997 and of the [[Statistical Society of Canada]] in 2004–5.
